baseline: The distinctiveness of anxiety and depression is discussed concerning their nature, definitions, uses, manifestations and determinants.
high_intensity: The overwhelming distinctiveness of anxiety and depression is discussed concerning their intense nature, definitions, dramatic manifestations, and pervasive determinants.
low_intensity: The mild distinctiveness of anxiety and depression is discussed concerning their gentle nature, definitions, subtle manifestations, and basic determinants.

baseline: Follow-up analyses indicated that when compared to CBT, greater Working Alliance Inventory during MBSR was meaningful in that it predicted long-term (12-month follow-up) social anxiety symptom reduction (R2 = .12).
high_intensity: Follow-up analyses indicated that when compared to CBT, greater Working Alliance Inventory during MBSR was significant in that it predicted long-term (12-month follow-up) severe social anxiety symptom reduction (R2 = .12).
low_intensity: Follow-up analyses indicated that when compared to CBT, greater Working Alliance Inventory during MBSR was meaningful in that it predicted long-term (12-month follow-up) mild social anxiety symptom reduction (R2 = .12).

baseline: Validity was assessed by comparing BAI scores among 3 different diagnostic categories in a clinical sample (anxiety disorder, mood disorder, and comorbid anxiety/mood disorder diagnostic groups) and a community sample of participants with no self-reported mental_health diagnoses.
high_intensity: Validity was intensely assessed by comparing BAI scores among 3 severe diagnostic categories in a clinical sample (extreme anxiety disorder, mood disorder, and comorbid anxiety/mood disorder diagnostic groups) and a community sample of participants with no self-reported mental_health diagnoses.
low_intensity: Validity was assessed by comparing BAI scores among 3 different diagnostic categories in a clinical sample (mild anxiety disorder, mood disorder, and comorbid mild anxiety/mood disorder diagnostic groups) and a community sample of participants with no self-reported mental_health diagnoses.

baseline: The results revealed problems in establishing measurement invariance of the HSCL-25 depression and anxiety and SCL-90-Somatization scales.
high_intensity: The results revealed significant problems in establishing measurement invariance of the HSCL-25 depression and intense anxiety and SCL-90-Somatization scales.
low_intensity: The results revealed minor problems in establishing measurement invariance of the HSCL-25 depression and mild anxiety and SCL-90-Somatization scales.

baseline: Across a series of experiments, we explore the efficacy of a common strategy that people employ to cope with performance-induced anxiety: rituals.
high_intensity: Across a series of experiments, we delve into the efficacy of a powerful strategy that people employ to manage overwhelming performance-induced anxiety: rituals.
low_intensity: Across a series of experiments, we explore the efficacy of a common strategy that people employ to cope with mild performance-induced anxiety: rituals.

baseline: Using the meta-themes that emerged in each vocational stressor category, t-test results show that the experience of discrimination stressors was related to higher levels of self-reported anxiety, depression and sleep disturbances.
high_intensity: Using the meta-themes that emerged in each vocational stressor category, t-test results show that the experience of discrimination stressors was related to severe levels of self-reported anxiety, deep depression, and intense sleep disturbances.
low_intensity: Using the meta-themes that emerged in each vocational stressor category, t-test results show that the experience of discrimination stressors was related to moderate levels of self-reported anxiety, mild depression, and sleep disturbances.

baseline: High cognitive bias scores were significantly associated with elevated levels of anxiety symptoms, depression, PTSD symptoms, and mental defeat.
high_intensity: High cognitive bias scores were significantly associated with extreme levels of anxiety symptoms, severe depression, intense PTSD symptoms, and profound mental defeat.
low_intensity: High cognitive bias scores were significantly associated with moderate levels of anxiety symptoms, mild depression, PTSD symptoms, and mental challenges.

baseline: Lack of maintenance on vacant neighborhood lots is associated with higher levels of depression, anxiety, and stress for nearby residents.
high_intensity: Lack of maintenance on vacant neighborhood lots is associated with overwhelming levels of depression, intense anxiety, and stress for nearby residents.
low_intensity: Lack of maintenance on vacant neighborhood lots is associated with higher levels of depression, mild anxiety, and stress for nearby residents.

baseline: Pre- and posttreatment data from 18 patients shows a significant reduction in cardiovascular hospital admissions and length of stay, panic attacks, general anxiety, and depression (all <.05).
high_intensity: Pre- and posttreatment data from 18 patients shows an overwhelming reduction in cardiovascular hospital admissions and length of stay, frequent panic attacks, severe general anxiety, and deep depression (all <.05).
low_intensity: Pre- and posttreatment data from 18 patients shows a noticeable reduction in cardiovascular hospital admissions and length of stay, occasional panic attacks, mild general anxiety, and slight depression (all <.05).

baseline: Completers reported significant improvements in depression and anxiety symptoms, affect, self-esteem and interpersonal functioning dimensions related to assertiveness, attention to ones needs and capacity to connect.
high_intensity: Completers reported substantial improvements in depression and intense anxiety symptoms, affect, self-esteem, and interpersonal functioning dimensions related to assertiveness, attention to one's needs, and capacity to connect.
low_intensity: Completers reported noticeable improvements in depression and mild anxiety symptoms, affect, self-esteem, and interpersonal functioning dimensions related to assertiveness, attention to one's needs, and capacity to connect.
